title: Indian State Refiners Back Off Russian Oil Buying as U.S. Escalates Tariffs
summary: The biggest Indian state-owned refiners are pulling out of spot purchases of Russian crude for cargoes loading in October, sources familiar with the procurement plans told Bloomberg on Thursday, a day after the U.S.
fullContent: The biggest Indian state-owned refiners are pulling out of spot purchases of Russian crude for cargoes loading in October, sources familiar with the procurement plans told Bloomberg on Thursday, a day after the U.S. announced an additional 25% tariff on India over its imports of crude from Russia. U.S. President Donald Trump signed on Wednesday an executive order enacting an additional 25% tariff on Indian goods, explicitly targeting India’s ongoing imports of Russian crude oil. This order increases the total tariff rate on Indian…

title: Hong Kong coach cleared of molesting women’s football team player
summary: A court has cleared a 42-year-old coach of molesting a former player on the Hong Kong women’s football team on two occasions in 2021 after highlighting inconsistencies in the complainant’s evidence.
fullContent: A court has cleared a 42-year-old coach of molesting a former player on the Hong Kong women’s football team on two occasions in 2021 after highlighting inconsistencies in the complainant’s evidence. West Kowloon Court on Thursday found Wong Chi-wai not guilty of two counts of indecent assault and pointed to “crucial” discrepancies between the written and oral testimonies of the woman, who had also worked at the defendant’s sportswear firm. Magistrate Peter Yu Chun-cheung said the witness,...

title: US Continuing Claims Rise to Highest Since November 2021
summary: Recurring applications for unemployment benefits surged to the highest since November 2021, as continuing claims rose by 38,000 to 1.97 million in the week ended July 26. Initial claims also rose, to 226,000, last week, slightly higher than economists expected.
fullContent: Recurring applications for unemployment benefits surged to the highest since November 2021, as continuing claims rose by 38,000 to 1.97 million in the week ended July 26. Initial claims also rose, to 226,000, last week, slightly higher than economists expected. Michael McKee reports on Bloomberg Television.
